author: Erik Wasson, Jennifer A Dlouhy, Steven T. Dennis
description: Senate Republican leaders continue to scrounge for votes to pass Donald Trump’s $3.3 trillion tax and spending bill as lingering intraparty fights threaten to upend the legislative centerpiece of the president’s domestic agenda.
title: Senate Heads Into All-Nighter on Trump Tax Bill With GOP Divided

author: Michelle Ma
description: A proposed excise tax would exacerbate the pain from the phaseout of subsidies.
title: Solar, Wind Industries See Existential Threat in Senate Tax Bill

author: Laura Nahmias
description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams reached a deal with the City Council on a $115.9 billion budget, adding new funding for legal services for migrants and more money for early childhood education.
title: NYC Passes $116 Billion Budget With Boost to Migrant Legal Aid

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: A group of Senate Republicans is pushing a plan to soften an aggressive planned phase out of subsidies for wind and solar projects under President Donald Trump’s tax-and-spending package.
title: Senate Republicans Seek to Ease Solar and Wind Tax Credit Cutoff

author: Kristina Peterson
description: Italy will increase its imports of US soybeans as part of a new effort to rebalance trade between the two countries, US Agriculture Secretary Brooke Rollins told reporters Monday after meeting with her Italian counterpart.
title: US Plans to Boost Soy Exports to Italy and Form New Task Force

author: William Horobin
description: Digital services taxes targeting the revenue of big technology companies have returned as a flash point in President Donald Trump’s efforts to rewrite the rules of global trade.
title: What Are the Digital Services Taxes Drawing Trump’s Ire?

author: Courtney McBride
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is expected to meet with President Donald Trump at the White House on July 7, according to Israeli and US officials, as the administration urges its ally to end the war in Gaza and secure the release of the remaining hostages held by Hamas.
title: Netanyahu Is Set to Meet Trump at White House on July 7

author: Jordan Robertson, Hannah Levitt, Jake Bleiberg, Jason Leopold
description: In three major hacks, Treasury didn’t deploy cybersecurity measures that could have prevented the attacks or flagged the intruders sooner, a Bloomberg News investigation found.
title: A Trio of US Treasury Hacks Exposes a Pattern Making Banks Nervous

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Thailand’s most influential political dynasty is facing two high-profile legal battles, with an unfavorable outcome for Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra likely to deepen a political crisis that’s already pushed her government to the brink of collapse.
title: Thai Political Crisis Deepens as Shinawatras Face Legal Battles

author: Brandon Sapienza
description: Elon Musk once again threatened to ramp up his political spending, this time targeting nearly every sitting Republican in Congress who has signaled support for President Donald Trump’s multi-trillion dollar tax bill.
title: Musk Lashes Out at Tax Bill Proponents, Threatens to Unseat Lawmakers

author: Gregory Korte
description: The Senate’s version of President Donald Trump’s proposed tax cut bill will cost the bottom 20% of taxpayers an average of $560 a year while giving an average boost of $6,055 to those at the top end.
title: Richest 20% Get an Average $6,055 Income Boost in Trump Tax Bill

author: Erik Larson
description: A judge overseeing a challenge to President Donald Trump’s restrictions on automatic birthright citizenship asked the US government to confirm it won’t seek to deport impacted children during the Supreme Court’s 30-day pause on the directive.
title: Judge Seeks US Assurances on Deportations in Birthright Case

author: Stephanie Lai, Hadriana Lowenkron
description: The prospective buyer of TikTok’s American operations cited by President Donald Trump is the same investor consortium including Oracle Corp., Blackstone Inc. and venture capital firm Andreessen Horowitz, whose bid for the app had stalled amid US-China trade tensions, according to a person familiar with the matter.
title: Trump’s TikTok Buyer Is the Same Group Behind a Previous Stalled Bid

author: Ailbhe Rea
description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer is girding for what could be the most consequential vote of his premiership, with Labour rebels warning that the government’s welfare overhaul still risks defeat despite huge concessions to push it through parliament.
title: Starmer’s Welfare Overhaul Hangs in Balance Ahead of Key Vote

author: Catherine Lucey, Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: President Donald Trump threatened to impose a fresh tariff level on Japan, citing what he said was the country’s unwillingness to accept rice exports from the US.
title: Trump Threatens to Impose Tariff on Japan, Citing Rice Exports

author: Jorge Valero, Alberto Nardelli
description: The European Union is willing to accept a trade arrangement with the US that includes a 10% universal tariff on many of the bloc’s exports, but wants the US to commit to lower rates on key sectors such as pharmaceuticals, alcohol, semiconductors and commercial aircraft.
title: EU to Accept Trump’s Universal Tariff But Seeks Key Exemptions

author: Eric Martin
description: President Donald Trump will sign an executive order on Monday terminating the US sanctions program against Syria, White House spokeswoman Karoline Leavitt said, a bid to boost the nation’s struggling economy and support the new government after rebels overthrew President Bashar Al-Assad last year.
title: Trump to Terminate Syria Sanctions Program, White House Says

author: Madlin Mekelburg
description: The Trump administration sued Los Angeles claiming its sanctuary city ordinance helped fuel riots during protests against the president’s deportation crackdown, prompting the US to send in national guard troops.
title: Trump Lawsuit Claims Los Angeles’ Sanctuary Policy Fueled Riots

author: Alessandra Migliaccio, Sonia Sirletti
description: Italy’s cabinet approved a decree that lets almost 500,000 documented immigrants enter the country in the next three years.
title: Italy to Allow 500,000 New Migrant Entries in Next Three Years

author: Deena Shanker
description: More than 40 million people relied on the food-assistance program in 2024, or about 12% of the population. Many are located in red districts represented by legislators who support gutting the aid.
title: SNAP Cuts in Big Tax Bill Will Hit a Lot of Trump Voters Too

author: Akayla Gardner
description: Harvard University’s talks with the White House have stalled, according to a person familiar with the matter, threatening a quick resolution to a standoff that’s threatening the school’s finances and upending foreign student plans.
title: Harvard-White House Talks Stall, Threatening Quick Settlement

author: Sudhi Ranjan Sen
description: Supply agreements for critical minerals will dominate Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s visit to Ghana, Namibia, Brazil, Argentina and Trinidad & Tobago starting Wednesday as the South Asian country’s industry grapples with restricted supplies from China.
title: Critical Minerals to Top Modi’s Agenda in Five-Nation Tour

author: Greg Stohr
description: The US Supreme Court ordered reconsideration of rulings backing transgender rights in clashes over health care and birth certificates, while holding off saying whether the justices will take up a polarizing fight over sports participation in their next term.
title: Transgender-Rights Rulings Warrant New Look, Supreme Court Says

author: Ilya Arkhipov
description: Russia summoned Azerbaijan’s ambassador after police in Baku raided the office of a Russian state-funded media outlet amid deteriorating relations between the former Soviet neighbors.
title: Russia Summons Azerbaijani Envoy as Tensions Flare Over Arrests

author: Eyk Henning
description: The Dutch government needs more time to assess the options for TenneT Holding BV’s German high-voltage business and a decision is likely to come in September.
title: Netherlands Delays Decision on TenneT’s German Grid Deal

author: Dan Williams
description: Israel expressed openness to peace with Syria, a change of tack after warning against engaging with the new Islamist-rooted government that took power last year.
title: Israel Eyes Peace with Syria After Months of Scorning New Leader

author: Jarrell Dillard, Erik Wasson, Chris Cioffi
description: Senate Republicans are moving forward with a plan to mask the $3.8 trillion cost of extending expiring tax cuts in President Donald Trump’s signature economic legislation by using an unprecedented accounting maneuver.
title: Republicans Agree to Mask $3.8 Trillion of Trump Tax Bill Costs

author: Thomas Gualtieri, Daniel Basteiro
description: Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez’s former top adviser was remanded in custody Monday in a corruption probe that could further threaten the embattled Spanish premier’s hold on power.
title: Spanish Prime Minister’s Former Top Aide Remanded in Custody

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: The US government told Harvard it violated federal civil-rights law in its treatment of Jewish and Israeli students, ratcheting up the pressure on the oldest and richest US university to reach a settlement with the Trump administration to restore funding.
title: Harvard Violated Civil Rights of Jewish Students, US Says

author: Philip Sanders
description: Chile’s peso rallied Monday on speculation that a landslide victory for Communist Jeannette Jara in a left-wing primary will make a win for the opposition right in November’s election all the more likely.
title: Chile Peso Gains as Communist Win Is Seen as a Step Too Far for Left

author: Greg Stohr
description: The US Supreme Court agreed to consider Republican calls to strike down federal caps on the money political parties can spend on advertisements in coordination with congressional candidates.
title: GOP Gets Supreme Court Review on Political Party Spending Caps

author: Greg Stohr
description: The US Supreme Court refused to question an Internal Revenue Service summons that forced Coinbase Global Inc. to turn over transaction information for more than 14,000 cryptocurrency customers.
title: Supreme Court Rebuffs Bid to Protect Coinbase User Data From IRS

author: Greg Stohr
description: The US Supreme Court agreed to consider shielding Cox Communications Inc. from a $1 billion lawsuit by the music industry, in a case that could give internet providers new legal protections when users pirate copyrighted works.
title: Supreme Court to Hear Cox Appeal in $1 Billion Music Piracy Case

author: Erik Wasson, Jamie Tarabay, Ken Tran
description: Republican party leaders are rushing to overcome lingering internal fights over President Donald Trump’s massive tax and spending package as Democrats launch attacks to exploit the divisions.
title: Trump, Republicans Rush to Overcome Internal Clashes on One Big Beautiful Bill

author: Jack Ryan
description: The UK will limit the growth of tariff-free steel imports to guard against a rush of products being redirected from the US.
title: UK Tightens Steel Import Tariff Regime to Fend Off Cheap Imports

author: Andra Timu
description: Moldova’s ruling pro-European party is leading in a new opinion poll three months ahead of a general election that’s crucial for maintaining the country’s course to join the European Union by the end of the decade.
title: Moldovan Pro-European Party Leads Poll Before Key Election

author: Ougna Camara
description: Guinea’s interim parliament proposed that presidential term limits be extended, months before the country is scheduled to hold elections after four years of military rule.
title: Guinea Proposes Extension of Presidential Term to Seven Years

author: Marton Kasnyik
description: The record-breaking turnout at Hungary’s annual Pride march, held in defiance of a police ban encouraged by Prime Minister Viktor Orban, highlighted surging opposition to his 15-year rule.
title: Budapest Pride Ban Backfires as Orban Continues Slump in Polls

author: Yuliya Fedorinova, Andy Lin (News), Julian Luk
description: Russian base metals sales to China surged in the first five months of 2025, underscoring its economic dependence on its Asian neighbor even as the country seeks to diversify trade.
title: Russia Base Metals Sales to China Surge, Signaling Deep Reliance

author: Sara Sjolin
description: Danish companies will get easier access to foreign labor under a plan presented by the government that seeks to balance its harsh anti-immigration stance with the demands of the Nordic nation’s economy.
title: Immigration Hawk Denmark Loosens Rules for Foreign Workers

author: Souhail Karam, Samy Adghirni
description: Algeria jailed a French sports journalist for seven years on charges of “glorifying terrorism,” amid a simmering feud between the North African nation and its former colonial rulers.
title: Algeria Jails French Football Reporter for Seven Years

author: Michael Cohen
description: South Africa’s currency gained after the nation’s fractious ruling coalition weathered its latest storm when a key partner opted to remain in the government.
title: Rand Strengthens as South Africa’s Coalition Avoids Collapse

author: Selcan Hacaoglu, Michael Nienaber
description: Turkey’s bid to buy Eurofighter Typhoon jets has won support from all consortium members, the UK said, raising prospects for a deal previously blocked by Germany.
title: UK Says Turkey’s Eurofighter Bid Gains Full Consortium Backing

author: Piotr Skolimowski, Andras Gergely
description: Budapest just hosted one of the biggest displays of defiance of the Hungarian premier’s 15 years in office.
title: Viktor Orban’s Hold on Hungary May Be Slipping

author: Nancy Cook
description: The Trump White House is moving at a far faster clip in 2025 to remake the federal government and American life, in large part because Stephen Miller has put the agenda on steroids.
title: Stephen Miller Directs Trump’s Policies on Immigration, Ivy League

author: Lionel Laurent
description: A coalition of the willing against US threats is struggling to take form.
title: Tariff Bullying Is Working Too Well in Europe

author: Firat Kozok, Beril Akman
description: A Turkish court adjourned a case on the main opposition party’s leadership, providing short-term relief for markets concerned about rising political uncertainty.
title: Turkish Court Delays Opposition Case That Has Markets on Edge

author: Cliff Harvey Venzon
description: The Philippines and Lithuania have agreed to strengthen defense ties, as both nations face maritime security threats.
title: Philippines, Lithuania Elevate Defense Ties Amid China Tensions

author: Qianwei Zhang, Jing Li
description: Membership in China’s ruling Communist Party passed the 100 million mark, but the pace of growth slowed for the third straight year amid Beijing’s long-running push to rein in the party’s expansion.
title: China’s Communist Party Inches Past 100 Million-Member Milestone

author: Alex Wickham
description: UK car manufacturers can export to the US under a 10% tariff starting Monday, a reduction from the 25% rate imposed by Donald Trump on other countries, as the first elements of an economic agreement between the US president and Prime Minister Keir Starmer come into effect.
title: US-UK Auto Tariff Cut Comes Into Effect but No Progress on Steel

author: Alan Wong
description: One of Hong Kong’s last remaining pro-democracy parties has shut down, marking another blow to a decades-long movement for greater freedoms that has largely collapsed under Beijing’s crackdown on dissent.
title: Hong Kong’s Last Active Pro-Democracy Group Folds After 19 Years

author: Marc Champion
description: Tehran will have to adapt, just not necessarily with another revolution.
title: This Isn’t the Iranian Regime Change You’re Looking For

author: Melissa Shin, Derek Decloet
description: Canada has withdrawn its digital services tax on technology companies such as Meta Platforms Inc. and Alphabet Inc. in a move to restart trade talks with the US.
title: Canada Drops Digital Tax That Infuriated Trump to Restart Trade Talks

author: Oma Seddiq, Emily Birnbaum
description: The Senate is poised to approve a controversial provision preventing some US states from regulating artificial intelligence, marking a victory for the tech companies, venture capital firms and startups that backed it.
title: Key Senators Strike Deal To Pause State AI Laws For Five Years

author: Michael Heath
description: China’s envoy to Canberra urged Australia not to be “incited” by NATO’s support for US demands to sharply raise defense spending and instead cooperate with Beijing to resolve regional disputes.
title: China’s Envoy Urges Australia to Resist US Pressure on Military Spending
